intro: Scrophularia edgeworthii, commonly known as Edgeworth's figwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes many species with showy flowers and medicinal uses. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, with two lips that are characteristic of the genus. Scrophularia edgeworthii is often found in open areas with limited competition, such as meadows and stream banks.
